name: Lavender
description: Fresh, floral aroma that gently supports relaxation and calm.
supports: Survivors of PTSD, C-PTSD, sexual assault, trafficking, domestic abuse, incarceration, foster care, systemic trauma, cultural trauma, racism, gender-based violence. Individuals diagnosed with anxiety, depression, bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, dissociative disorders, substance use disorder, HIV/AIDS, chronic illness, IDDs, neurodivergence. LGBTQIA individuals, immigrants, undocumented individuals, survivors of medical system trauma, housing insecurity, ACEs, and SDOH inequities.
how_it_supports: Promotes nervous system downregulation; aids in sleep recovery for trauma-linked insomnia; provides sensory safety and predictability.
sundowning_note: Reduces evening agitation and disorientation.
respiratory_notes: Gentle floral, generally tolerated well, generally safe for asthma, COPD, sensitive lungs.
blending_note: Blends well with grounding Vetiver or uplifting Lemon to create balance — offering calm while supporting energy for survivors of trauma fatigue.

name: Roman Chamomile
description: Soft, apple-like floral aroma known for easing distress and supporting rest.
supports: Survivors of systemic trauma, racism, sexual violence, trafficking, domestic abuse, incarceration, foster care. Individuals diagnosed with PTSD, depression, anxiety, bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, dissociative disorders, HIV/AIDS, chronic illness, IDDs, neurodivergence. LGBTQIA individuals, immigrants, undocumented individuals, survivors of medical system trauma, ACEs, SDOH inequities.
how_it_supports: Eases irritability, panic, and agitation; supports rest for trauma-related insomnia; provides gentle sensory safety.
sundowning_note: Calms evening agitation and confusion.
respiratory_notes: Safe for asthma/COPD; mild, apple-like aroma and allergy-sensitive.
blending_note: Blends with Lavender for deep calm or Neroli for uplift. Creates a gentle, regulated environment for rest.

name: Neroli
description: Floral-citrus scent, uplifting yet gentle; helps reduce trauma-related hypervigilance.
region: Africa & African Diaspora (Morocco, Tunisia) & West Africa
supports: Survivors of systemic trauma, racism, identity trauma, sexual assault, trafficking, domestic abuse, incarceration, foster care. Individuals diagnosed with PTSD, anxiety, depression, bipolar disorder, dissociative disorders, substance use disorder, HIV/AIDS, chronic illness, IDDs, neurodivergence, schizophrenia. LGBTQIA individuals, immigrants, undocumented individuals, survivors of medical trauma, housing insecurity, ACEs, SDOH inequities.
how_it_supports: Reduces hypervigilance and trauma-linked anxiety; stabilizes mood; fosters hopefulness and safety.
sundowning_note: Eases evening anxiety and irritability.
respiratory_notes: Gentle citrus-floral; safe in moderation (#respiratorysafe) avoid overexposure for sensitive lungs.
blending_note: Blends well with Sandalwood or Cedarwood for stability, Jasmine for brightness, and Chamomile for tenderness. Pairings balance hypervigilance with comfort, creating both emotional safety & regulation through balance of steadiness and lightness.

name: Frankincense
description: Resinous, woody aroma that anchors and stabilizes.
region: East Africa, North Africa, West Africa & African Diaspora
how_it_supports: Anchors dysregulated states in PTSD and C-PTSD; supports moral injury in veterans; stabilizes nervous system responses in survivors navigating systemic trauma.
sundowning_note: Encourages stability during evening disorientation.
respiratory_notes: Resinous but generally tolerated well in diffuser use.⚠️ Can feel heavy for COPD or sensitive lungs (#respiratorycaution).
blending_note: Pairs with Neroli for gentle regulation or Sandalwood for depth. Supports survivors who need both grounding and safety in sensory input.

name: Vetiver
description: Deep, earthy scent that feels like rooted soil; stabilizes emotions and dissociation.
how_it_supports: Provides sensory grounding for dissociation; reduces hyperarousal and panic; stabilizes trauma-related nervous system responses.
sundowning_note: Anchors evening disorientation in dementia survivors.
respiratory_notes: ⚠️ Can feel heavy for COPD or sensitive lungs (#respiratorycaution) Strong earthy tone; very earthy and smoky(diffuse sparingly).
blending_note: Deep earthiness balances well with Sweet Orange or Grapefruit for lift, Chamomile or Neroli for sensory gentleness, or Vanilla for nurture.

name: Myrrh
description: Warm, slightly balsamic scent used for centuries in African and Middle Eastern healing.
how_it_supports: Aids attention regulation for ADHD; stabilizes fragmented emotional states; supports grief and chronic stress.
sundowning_note: Helps manage agitation linked to disorientation at dusk.
respiratory_notes: ⚠️ Resinous and thick; diffuse sparingly & gently (#respiratorycaution).
blending_note: Resonates with Frankincense or Copal for clarity, Neroli or Jasmine to ease density, Cedarwood or Sandalwood to root grief, and Kewra or Vanilla to soften resin sharpness.

name: Blue Tansy
description: Moroccan wildflower with a calming, sweet herbal scent.
region: North Africa (Morocco); West Africa & African Diaspora
how_it_supports: Reduces nervous system inflammation responses; calms panic and restlessness; supports sensory sensitivity.
sundowning_note: Calms agitation when confusion intensifies late afternoon.
respiratory_notes: #respiratorysafe Mild herbal; generally well tolerated.
blending_note: Balances with Lavender or Chamomile, Citrus (Lemon, Bergamot) for brightness, and Copaiba for nervous system calm.

name: Opopanax
description: Warm, sweet resin aroma; gentler than frankincense or myrrh.
region: East Africa; West Africa & African Diaspora
how_it_supports: Provides gentle sensory safety; stabilizes moods without overwhelming; supports emotional regulation.
sundowning_note: Gentle resinous tone helps ease fear at nightfall.
respiratory_notes: Mild resinous; diffuser safe.
blending_note: Blends well with Frankincense or Neroli for balancing; softens with Sweet Orange.

name: Sandalwood
description: Warm, creamy wood note used across Asia for grounding and nervous system calm.
region: Asian Asia; widely used in the African Diaspora
how_it_supports: Restores emotional balance; supports nervous system regulation; fosters calm during overwhelm.
sundowning_note: Encourages serenity in evening disorientation.
respiratory_notes: Gentle woody; generally well tolerated.
blending_note: Blends with citrus oils (Lemon, Grapefruit) to lighten, or with Jasmine for depth.

name: Ylang Ylang
description: Sweet, exotic floral scent traditionally used in Pacific Islander communities for relaxation.
region: Pacific Islands; also used in African Diaspora
how_it_supports: Reduces blood pressure; calms panic attacks; supports mood balance.
sundowning_note: Sweet floral helps reduce agitation in late afternoon transitions.
respiratory_notes: Strong floral; diffuse lightly for sensitive lungs.
pregnancy_notes: ⚠️ #pregnancycaution (can be cloying or trigger nausea; light use only).
blending_note: Blended with Vetiver or Cedarwood for grounding, or citrus (Bergamot) for uplift.

name: Jasmine
strength: Strong (intensely floral, use lightly in diffuser)
description: A sweet, romantic floral traditionally used across Asia for adornment and ritual.
region: Asia (India, Southeast Asia), North Africa, West Africa & African Diaspora
supports: Survivors of sexual trauma, gender-based violence, systemic trauma, cultural trauma. Individuals with depression, anxiety, PTSD, bipolar disorder, and trauma-related dysphoria. LGBTQIA individuals, immigrants, and ACEs survivors.
how_it_supports: Elevates mood without sedation; reduces dysphoria and emotional heaviness; restores self-expression.
sundowning_note: Bright floral helps redirect agitation toward soothing sensory input.
respiratory_notes: Intense floral; use lightly, may be overwhelming in high concentration.
pregnancy_notes: ⚠️ #pregnancycaution (small amounts only; can be too intense).
blending_note: Pairs with Sandalwood or Cedarwood for stability, Neroli or Bergamot to brighten, and Vanilla to soften its intensity.

name: Kewra
description: Sweet, fruity floral oil often used in South Asian rituals and foods.
supports: Survivors of systemic oppression, cultural trauma, racism, identity trauma. Individuals with PTSD, anxiety, depression, dissociation, or chronic stress.
how_it_supports: Helps regulate emotions through sensory brightness.
sundowning_note: Fruity-floral notes redirect agitation into ease.
respiratory_notes: Light fruity-floral; diffuser safe.
blending_note: Combines well with Sandalwood or Copaiba for anchoring, Sweet Orange for brightness, and Chamomile to soften.

name: Spikenard
description: Ancient sacred Himalayan root, deeply grounding.
region: Himalayan regions in Asia; recognized in African Diaspora healing
supports: Survivors of systemic trauma, incarceration, trafficking, domestic violence, racism, identity trauma.
how_it_supports: Provides strong anchor for dissociation and panic; stabilizes mood swings; supports deep rest.
sundowning_note: Earthy grounding scent can help settle evening disorientation.
respiratory_notes: Musky-earthy; may feel heavy for sensitive lungs.
blending_note: Blends well with Jasmine or Ylang Ylang to soften intensity; pairing offers grounding + mood lift.

name: Copaiba
description: A resin tapped from trees in the Amazon; sweet, grounding aroma.
how_it_supports: Provides soothing effect for chronic pain linked to trauma; fosters grounding for connection.
sundowning_note: Sweet resin notes calm late-day agitation.
respiratory_notes: Gentle balsamic; generally well tolerated.
blending_note: Works with Citrus (Lemon, Bergamot) to bring brightness, Vanilla for nurture, Cedarwood for stability.

name: Copal
description: Sacred Maya and Aztec resin, traditionally burned for cleansing and connection.
how_it_supports: Provides sensory connection, reduces overwhelm; restores focus.
sundowning_note: Can redirect agitation toward grounding connection.
respiratory_notes: Gentle resin; diffuser safe when pre-diluted.
blending_note: Blends well with Frankincense or Myrrh for depth, Neroli or Sweet Orange for uplift, Blue Tansy for calming.

name: Cedarwood
description: Grounding, woody scent used for protection and stability.
region: North Africa, West Africa, Indigenous Americas, Asian Himalayas
how_it_supports: Offers rootedness; stabilizes dysregulation; fosters sense of safety.
sundowning_note: Strong anchoring scent for late-afternoon confusion.
respiratory_notes: Woody, grounding; diffuse lightly for asthma-sensitive individuals.
blending_note: Complements bright citrus (Grapefruit, Lemon); balances florals (Jasmine).

name: Patchouli
description: Rich, earthy scent that connects to soil and grounding.
how_it_supports: Anchors & provides earthy sensory grounding.
sundowning_note: Deep earthiness supports orientation at dusk.
respiratory_notes: Strong earthy; may overwhelm sensitive lungs if overused.
blending_note: Pairs with Sweet Orange or Lime to brighten, Neroli or Jasmine for balance, Cedarwood or Copaiba for depth.

name: Vanilla
description: Warm, sweet scent linked to comfort and nurturing.
region: Latin America (Totonac origin), African Diaspora, Caribbean, West Africa
how_it_supports: Provides sensory comfort and nurturance; reduces agitation and panic linked to trauma.
sundowning_note: Comforting sweetness reduces late-day restlessness.
respiratory_notes: Soft; generally safe in diffuser.
blending_note: Blends with Sandalwood or Cedarwood for calm, Lemon or Grapefruit for brightness, Jasmine for floral depth.

name: Lemon
description: Crisp, clean citrus aroma known for uplifting energy.
how_it_supports: Uplifts mood and restores focus; counters depressive heaviness.
sundowning_note: Helps lift fatigue-related irritability in late day.
respiratory_notes: Citrus oils can be sensitizing; diffuse gently.
blending_note: Works with Lavender to calm sharpness, or Vetiver to anchor brightness.

name: Grapefruit
description: Sweet citrus scent, refreshing and uplifting.
how_it_supports: Encourages optimism and focus; supports trauma survivors with depressive symptoms.
sundowning_note: Refreshing citrus helps with evening low mood and confusion.
respiratory_notes: Sweet citrus; generally well tolerated but use moderately.
blending_note: Combines with Cedarwood or Vetiver to anchor, Neroli or Jasmine for balance, Vanilla for warmth.

name: Sweet Orange
description: Bright, cheerful citrus aroma often used to uplift mood and reduce tension.
supports: Survivors of systemic trauma, ACEs, identity trauma, racism, cultural trauma. Individuals with PTSD, anxiety, depression, ADHD, chronic fatigue.
how_it_supports: Reduces feelings of heaviness and sadness; encourages lightness and motivation.
sundowning_note: Brightens mood and reduces irritability during late-day transitions.
respiratory_notes: Citrus; diffuse moderately as can be sensitizing.
blending_note: Pairs with Cedarwood or Vetiver for grounding, Neroli or Jasmine for emotional balance, and Lavender to ease sharpness.

name: Bergamot
description: A light citrus oil with floral undertones; often used for mood support.
supports: Survivors of systemic trauma, sexual trauma, trafficking, identity trauma. Individuals with PTSD, anxiety, depression, eating disorders, or substance use recovery.
how_it_supports: Lifts mood while calming anxiety; balances states of hyperarousal and shutdown.
sundowning_note: Reduces tension and low mood in late afternoon.
respiratory_notes: Light citrus-floral; generally safe.
blending_note: Pairs with grounding oils (Frankincense, Cedarwood) and florals (Lavender, Neroli).

name: Rose
description: Precious floral used for centuries in Middle Eastern, African, and South Asian healing and ritual.
supports: Survivors of gender-based violence, systemic oppression, trafficking, cultural trauma, racism.
how_it_supports: Provides sensory dignity and nurturance; reduces trauma-linked grief, shame, and isolation.
sundowning_note: Gentle floral anchors evening confusion.
respiratory_notes: Strong floral; diffuse lightly for respiratory-sensitive individuals.
blending_note: Blends well with Frankincense or Sandalwood, or with Sweet Orange.

name: Magnolia
description: Ancient flower used in South and East Asia for ritual, mourning, and resilience.
supports: Survivors of systemic trauma, grief, cultural trauma, identity trauma.
how_it_supports: Supports grief processing; calms dysregulation; fosters embodied safety.
sundowning_note: Softens evening agitation with creamy floral presence.
respiratory_notes: Floral; diffuse lightly for sensitive lungs.
blending_note: Pairs with Cedarwood or Vetiver, or with Neroli for gentle brightness.

name: Marjoram
description: Traditionally used in Mediterranean, African, and Middle Eastern healing.
supports: Survivors of trauma-linked insomnia, systemic oppression, chronic stress.
how_it_supports: Eases insomnia; reduces trauma-linked hyperarousal; softens grief.
sundowning_note: Calms late-day tension, especially around sleep transitions.
respiratory_notes: Mild herbal; generally safe.
pregnancy_notes: ⚠️ #pregnancycaution — strong in high doses; diffuse lightly only.
blending_note: Works well with Lavender for sleep, Sweet Orange for ease, and Sandalwood for grounding.

name: Palo Santo
description: Sacred wood used by Indigenous communities in Latin America for cleansing and grounding.
supports: Survivors of systemic oppression, cultural trauma, medical trauma, grief.
how_it_supports: Offers sensory and cultural connection; supports grounding for survivors of displacement and identity trauma.
sundowning_note: Woody sweetness anchors disorientation.
respiratory_notes: Resinous; diffuse gently for sensitive lungs.
blending_note: Pairs with Sweet Orange or Neroli to uplift, and Frankincense or Myrrh for spiritual depth.

name: Hinoki
description: Sacred Japanese cypress, historically used in purification and healing rituals.
supports: Survivors of systemic oppression, identity trauma, cultural trauma.
how_it_supports: Offers sensory purification and renewal; supports nervous system regulation.
sundowning_note: Woody clarity reduces disorientation.
respiratory_notes: Woody-fresh; generally safe.
blending_note: Blends well with Lemon for brightness, Frankincense for grounding, and Jasmine for tenderness.

name: Sweet Olive
description: East Asian flower with sweet, complex aroma, used for ceremony and resilience.
supports: Survivors of cultural trauma, systemic oppression, identity trauma.
how_it_supports: Restores sensory pleasure and connection; softens heaviness.
sundowning_note: Bright floral helps redirect agitation toward soothing input.
respiratory_notes: Strong floral; always diffuse in dilution.
blending_note: Works with Sandalwood for depth, Sweet Orange for playfulness, and Neroli for brightness.

name: Lotus
description: Sacred flower in South and East Asian traditions, symbol of survival and renewal under oppression.
supports: Survivors of systemic trauma, identity trauma, cultural trauma, gender-based violence.
how_it_supports: Restores sense of dignity and clarity; supports survivors navigating identity-based oppression.
sundowning_note: Aquatic floral lightness soothes evening agitation.
respiratory_notes: Strong floral; diffuse only in dilution.
blending_note: Combines with Vetiver for grounding, Jasmine for depth, and Neroli for balance.

name: Champaca
description: Deep, rich, and velvety floral with honey-like sweetness and subtle tea/spice undertones.
supports: Survivors of systemic trauma, identity trauma, cultural trauma, gender-based violence.
how_it_supports: Champaca calms anxiety, grounds the body, and restores balance. Its warm floral scent soothes overwhelm, nurtures compassion, and supports rest.
sundowning_note: Exotic floral redirects agitation.
respiratory_notes: Strong floral; diffuse only in dilution.
blending_note: Blends well with Sandalwood for grounding, Neroli for brightness, and Vanilla for warmth.

name: Neroli
latin_name: Citrus aurantium var. amara, blossom absolute
description: Bright floral with citrus undertones; associated with emotional regulation and lightness.
supports: Individuals with PTSD, depression, anxiety, bipolar, borderline personality disorder
how_it_supports: Helps soften panic, restore emotional safety, and reduce trauma-linked hyperarousal.
sundowning_note: Light floral-citrus lifts low mood and disorientation.
respiratory_notes: Generally well tolerated; diffuser safe. ⚠️ Not pet safe. ⚠️ #allergencaution for sensitive individuals.
blending_note: Pairs with grounding oils (Cedarwood, Sandalwood), bright citrus (Grapefruit, Lemon), and gentle florals (Jasmine, Rose). Together these balance uplift with safety.

name: Geranium
description: Fresh, balancing floral with green undertones; supports stability.
supports: Individuals with PTSD, depression, anxiety, bipolar, borderline personality disorder
how_it_supports: Helps regulate mood swings, restore nervous system balance, and ease trauma-related irritability.
sundowning_note: Balances emotional states, easing confusion at dusk.
respiratory_notes: Floral-green; diffuser safe in moderation; generally allergen safe; pet safe; ⚠️ kid safe 10+.
blending_note: Works with Rose for nurturing, Citrus oils for brightness, and Cedarwood for grounding. These blends create emotional stability with gentle lightness.

name: Peru Balsam
description: Sweet balsamic resin with vanilla-like warmth.
supports: Individuals with PTSD, depression, dissociation, chronic illness
how_it_supports: Offers steady sensory nurture, calming trauma-linked agitation and grief heaviness.
sundowning_note: Sweet warmth reduces evening confusion.
respiratory_notes: Resinous; diffuser safe in small amounts; not allergen safe for all; ⚠️ pet caution; ⚠️ kid safe 10+.
blending_note: Works with Vanilla for nurturing comfort, Frankincense for grounding, or Sweet Orange for gentle brightness — balancing grief release with stability.

name: Elemi
description: Fresh resin with light citrus and pine undertones.
region_cultural_lineage: Traditionally used in healing and ceremony
supports: Individuals with PTSD, depression, anxiety, neurodivergence
how_it_supports: Clears mental fog, supports breath regulation, and steadies trauma-linked fatigue.
sundowning_note: Bright-resin tone reduces restlessness.
respiratory_notes: Diffuser safe; allergen safe; ⚠️ pet caution; kid safe 8+.
blending_note: Works with Frankincense for spiritual grounding, Grapefruit for clarity, and Cedarwood for steadiness — creating an energizing yet safe base for trauma recovery.

name: Cypress
description: Woody-fresh resin with green, slightly balsamic notes.
supports: Individuals with PTSD, depression, anxiety, chronic stress
how_it_supports: Provides steady refuge and grounding, reducing fear and overwhelm.
sundowning_note: Woody-fresh tone anchors evening disorientation.
respiratory_notes: Diffuser safe; allergen safe; ⚠️ pet caution; ⚠️ kid safe 10+.
blending_note: Combines with Lemon for balance, Frankincense for grounding, and Jasmine for gentle restoration — supporting emotional refuge with stability.

name: Linden Blossom
description: Soft floral with honey and green undertones.
how_it_supports: Relieves nervous agitation, eases grief heaviness, and regulates trauma-linked sleeplessness.
sundowning_note: Gentle floral anchors nighttime calm.
respiratory_notes: Diffuser safe; ⚠️ allergen caution (pollen-sensitive); pet safe; kid safe 6+.
blending_note: Works with Chamomile for deeper rest, Vanilla for softness, and Bergamot for balance — supporting survivors with grief or insomnia in safe calm.

name: Sea Fennel
description: Marine, herbaceous, with subtle citrus undertones.
how_it_supports: Relieves nervous tension, softens hypervigilance, and restores calm regulation.
sundowning_note: Gentle marine-herb note eases evening unease.
respiratory_notes: Diffuser safe; allergen safe; pet safe; ⚠️ kid safe 10+.
blending_note: Blends with Neroli for brightness, Cedarwood for grounding, and Grapefruit for light energy — balancing survivors’ need for calm with steady vitality.

name: Black Spruce
description: Fresh coniferous with slightly sweet resin tones.
supports: Individuals with PTSD, depression, anxiety, neurodivergence
how_it_supports: Provides stabilizing presence, restoring regulation during trauma-linked overwhelm.
sundowning_note: Fresh conifer steadies evening unease.
respiratory_notes: Diffuser safe; allergen safe; pet safe; kid safe 6+.
blending_note: Works with Cedarwood for depth, Grapefruit for energy, and Rose for softness — balancing safety with resilience.

name: Palo Santo
description: Woody, citrusy, resinous, with a soft sweetness.
supports: Individuals with PTSD, depression, dissociation, chronic stress
how_it_supports: Provides cultural and sensory grounding; restores stability for trauma survivors navigating identity trauma.
sundowning_note: Woody-citrus anchors evening unease.
respiratory_notes: Diffuser safe; ⚠️ allergen caution (resin sensitivity); ⚠️ pet caution; ⚠️ kid safe 10+.
blending_note: Blends with Sweet Orange for balance, Frankincense for depth, and Jasmine for comfort — supporting cultural grounding with emotional regulation.

name: Clary Sage
description: Herbaceous, slightly sweet with soft floral undertones.
supports: Individuals with PTSD, depression, anxiety, bipolar disorder
how_it_supports: Restores embodied vitality, regulates trauma-linked mood extremes, and eases exhaustion.
sundowning_note: Herbaceous tone helps regulate agitation.
respiratory_notes: Diffuser safe in moderation; ⚠️ allergen caution (herbal sensitivity); ⚠️ pet caution; ⚠️ kid safe 10+.
blending_note: Blends with Lavender for rest, Bergamot for mood balance, and Cedarwood for grounding — supporting survivors balancing fatigue and dysregulation.
